title: Coye Francies
text:
Coye Glenn Francies (born November 15, 1986) is a former <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="cornerback">cornerback</a>. Francies grew up in <a href="Rancho%20Cordova%2C%20California">Rancho Cordova, California</a> and played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="American%20River%20College">American River</a>, <a href="Oregon%20State%20Beavers%20football">Oregon State</a>, and <a href="San%20Jose%20State%20Spartans%20football">San Jose State</a>. In the <a href="2009%20NFL%20Draft">2009 NFL Draft</a>, the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a> drafted Francies in the sixth round.
Early years.
At <a href="Cordova%20High%20School%20%28California%29">Cordova High School</a> in <a href="Rancho%20Cordova%2C%20California">Rancho Cordova, California</a>, Francies lettered in <a href="high%20school%20football">football</a> and <a href="track%20and%20field">track and field</a>.
Francies attended <a href="American%20River%20College">American River College</a> from 2004–05. As a sophomore, he led the team in pass interceptions (11) and was named Mid-Empire Conference Defensive MVP. He also earned 2005 California Community College All-American honors and was listed as the No. 62 junior college player in the nation by "<a href="Rivals.com">Rivals.com</a>".
Francies transferred to <a href="Oregon%20State%20University">Oregon State University</a> to continue his collegiate career. He played in all 14 games and started five times for the Beavers in the <a href="2006%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20FBS%20football%20season">2006 season</a>. Oregon State won the <a href="2006%20Sun%20Bowl">2006 Sun Bowl</a>. However, Francies was thrown off the team in the summer of 2007 after a gun registered to him was found during a traffic stop.
He then transferred to <a href="San%20Jose%20State%20University">San Jose State University</a>, where he redshirted the 2007 season. Returning to the field in 2008, Francies 69 tackles (45 solo), three interceptions and two forced fumbles. He also returned six kicks for 148 yards and ten punts for 29 yards. Francies was named 2nd Team All-WAC in 2008.
Professional career.
2009 NFL Draft.
Francies entered the combine a projected second- or third-round pick according to NFL scouts, but after slow 40-yard dash times he was projected to slide to the fourth or fifth round. He eventually was one of the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a>' three sixth-round picks in the NFL Draft.
Cleveland Browns.
Francies was involved in a locker room altercation on September 25, 2009 in which he was the victim of a prank. Francies was seen storming into the locker room with a bucket of ice and hurled it at CB <a href="Brandon%20McDonald%20%28American%20football%29">Brandon McDonald</a>. Punches were reportedly thrown before <a href="All-Pro">All-Pro</a> DT <a href="Shaun%20Rogers%20%28American%20football%29">Shaun Rogers</a> escorted him out of the room. In six games with the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a>, Francies had four tackles and one <a href="pass%20deflected">pass deflected</a>. The Browns waived Francies on September 4, 2010.
Las Vegas Locomotives.
For the <a href="2010%20UFL%20season">2010 UFL season</a>, Francies signed with the <a href="Las%20Vegas%20Locomotives">Las Vegas Locomotives</a>. In eight games, Francies made 11.5 tackles and two interceptions, and Las Vegas won the <a href="2010%20UFL%20Championship%20Game">2010 UFL championship</a>.
Cleveland Browns (second stint).
Francies returned to the Cleveland Browns after his <a href="%23Las_Vegas_Locomotives_%282010%29">season in the UFL</a>, first signing to the Brown practice squad on December 1, 2010 and to the active roster on December 14. Francies played two games that season and had three tackles. The Browns waived Francies on September 3, 2011.
Seattle Seahawks.
On December 14, 2011, Francies signed with the <a href="Seattle%20Seahawks">Seattle Seahawks</a> to the practice squad. Francies re-signed with the team as a reserve and future free agent. Francies played three preseason games with Seattle in 2012, and he was waived by the Seahawks on August 27.
Oakland Raiders.
Two days after the Seahawks waived him, Francies signed with the <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a> on August 29 and played the final preseason game for the Raiders against the Seahawks. Francies fumbled a kickoff return in that game but still made the final 53-man roster, but the Raiders waived Francies on September 6 to make room for <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> <a href="Derek%20Hagan">Derek Hagan</a>. On September 12, the Raiders signed Francies to the practice squad, and the team promoted Francies to the active roster on September 15. Francies played his first game with the Raiders in Week 2 on September 16 against the <a href="2012%20Miami%20Dolphins%20season">Miami Dolphins</a>. Francies made three tackles in 15 games in 2012. In the last game of the season against the <a href="2012%20San%20Diego%20Chargers%20season">San Diego Chargers</a>, Francies blocked a <a href="Punt%20%28gridiron%20football%29">punt</a> by <a href="Mike%20Scifres">Mike Scifres</a> late in the game.
On July 23, 2013, Francies was waived by the Oakland Raiders.
